What you need to know:

  • Learn more about actions you can take to urge the Senate to swiftly take action and boost SNAP benefits in the next COVID-19 relief package, including elevating this letter signed by nearly 2,500 organizations.
  • On May 15, the House passed the HEROES Act (H.R. 6800) with a vote of 208-199. The bill now moves to the Senate. Urge the Senate and the Administration to enact a COVID-19 recovery package that continues to provide nutrition and other needed assistance to struggling individuals and families. Check out FRAC’s statement, FRAC’s analysis, and the section-by-section summary from the House.
  • Looking for information on Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT)? All the updates are on our P-EBT webpage.

Share this image on social media to urge advocates to take action!

New Tools You Can Use

  • Community Eligibility Report

    The key to hunger-free schools during the 2019-2020 school year.

  • P-EBT FAQ

    Learn more about Pandemic EBT eligibility and states' implementation.

  • Pandemic EBT: A Critical Opportunity for States

    This resource provides information on the P-EBT program and helpful information for implementation, including resources.

  • Webinar Recording: CACFP during COVID-19

    Learn about new flexibilities designed to support CACFP providers, programs, and sponsors in the current COVID-19 public health emergency.

  • COVID-19 Child Nutrition Guidance and Meal Sites by State

    This map includes links to each state agency’s website that provides details on how to serve meals during school closures. Other resources include links or maps to meals sites, depending on availability.

  • CACFP Update: Families First Act

    FRAC’s update summarizing the Families First Act’s changes to Child and Adult Care Food Program waivers.

  • Summary of USDA's Nationwide Nutrition Waivers in Response to COVID-19

    The Families First Coronavirus Response Act gives the USDA the authority to issue nationwide waivers to ensure access to meals through the child nutrition programs as communities respond to COVID-19.

  • Maximizing WIC’s Role in Supporting Health, Food Security, and Safety During the COVID-19 Pandemic

    Actions that WIC, advocates, partner organizations, and state and local policymakers can take to help preserve access to WIC during this pandemic.

  • Summary of USDA's Nationwide Child Nutrition Waivers in Response to COVID-19

    Q&As from the USDA on the logistics of delivering meals through the Summer Food Service Program (SFSP) and the Seamless Summer Option (SSO) while using existing authority.

  • Summary of School Districts and Program Providers’ Efforts to Serve Meals During School Closings

    An spreadsheet compiled by FRAC of school districts serving meals and broken down by state, district, and model.
